5 Secrets to Become rich 1: Invest in you Successful people invest time, energy and money to improve themselves. A man once told me: "The best way to help people in need is not to be someone in need." Help yourself so you can help someone else. This means investing in yourself to be excellent at something. 2: Get great at what you do Commit to being great, not just average. Any industry can be a painful profession for average and low performing actors, but enormously rewarding for those who are great. Those who live, breathe and eat their profession, those who are obsessed, become great. I have never met a great player who was not totally consumed by his trade. You have? The fact is that if you're not great, you're average. The rich become great. 3: Create a budget. Remember the steps in point 2: earn more money, spend less and invest wisely. Point 3 included earning more money, and this covers spending less. Make a detailed budget for you based on your projected income and your current expenses. Set firm limits for your expenses and closely monitor where most of your money goes; You might be surprised at some of the areas where you waste more money. Once identified, you can start refining your budget to spend as little as possible and channel the rest to a savings or investment program. 4: Take risks. You're young. You have many years ahead. Now is the time to take risks. Invest in opportunities for higher risk and higher return actions. Consider leaving your job to start your own business. Jump on new businesses and new opportunities. If things go wrong, you will have plenty of time to make up for it. Most wealthy people will tell you that one of their biggest keys to success has been taking calculated risks. The majority of the population follows the safe route, so if you want to separate from the pack, you should try something new, possibly something uncomfortable. 5: Get multiple, connected income streams flowing You will not get rich without multiple income streams. That starts with the income you currently have. Increase that revenue and start adding multiple streams. You want what is called symbiotic flows. Don't just add disconnected flows. Instead, find other ways to add income to the work you already have. My boy video advertises for me, and after proving himself, he started making announcements for those connected to me. A donut shop did not start.

You can copy what the 1% do. It’s the best way to become rich. Generally, it’s pretty hard to claim ‘the best’ of anything. The best hotdog? The best hotel? The best car? It’s all a bit subjective, right? However, for wealth building there is a simple, non-negotiable, strategy that is the best. You have to have more wealth coming in than going out. It’s just simple math. You have to be adding more than you are subtracting. In general, this means making more money than you are spending. This comes down to talent and discipline. Talent will increase the money that you make, while the discipline will limit that amount of money you spend. But, there is one more variable that we are all subject to, that plays a significant role in wealth building: Taxes. The lower your tax burden, the more money you get to keep. For the 1% (this year in the US, that’s anyone making over $480,930), tax efficiency is almost as important as actual wealth creation.  Source: Bloomberg In addition to making sure that the money they are making is taxed as low as possible, the wealthy also pursue investments that are tax efficient to begin with. For example, in the US, municipal bonds are tax free. Municipal bonds are basically loans to cities. The interest that investors collect from these bonds are tax free. That’s a major incentive. But, only certain investors are actually taking advantage of this: "In 2015, Americans received $57 billion of tax-fee interest, according to the IRS. Just about half of that interest went to 1.2 million filers who earned $250,000 and more, which is how the IRS slices it.” Look above at that chart again. If half of the the tax-free interest is going to people who make $250,000 or more, then that means that 2% of the population is receiving half of that incentive. Clearly, that is a lop-sided return… the rich get richer… right? It’s true. The rich do get richer. Of course there are always bad actors in any industry, but there is a reason why wealthy people (and companies) continue to get wealthier. They continue to ensure that they are keeping as much wealth as possible. Just look at Ireland. The Los Angeles Times has said, “Ireland has become a mecca for US tech companies.” That’s because Ireland has a significantly lower corporate tax rate than the US. For the individual, there are all kinds of tax savings that you can take advantage of by simply looking at your tax law. It’s usually a very good idea to pay someone to do your taxes. And don’t be afraid to pay top dollar, as you usually get what you pay for… and that extra money you pay can often be well worth it in the long run. However, just like major corporations, it’s usually the best to be physically located in a location that has the best tax laws. If you are a non-US citizen, the world is your oyster. You can basically pick from dozens of countries that have favorable tax laws. That’s because non-US citizens do not have to pay their home country income taxes if they are living and sourcing their income from outside of their country. If you are a US citizen, then your options are very limited. US citizens are the only people in the world (except for those in the African nation of Eritrea) that have to pay taxes to their home country regardless of where they live or where they source their income. There are two main options for US citizens, if they choose to live and work outside of the US. First, they can take advantage of the FEIE, which is the Foreign Earned Income Exemption. Straight from the IRS website: "If you are a U.S. citizen or a resident alien of the United States and you live abroad, you are taxed on your worldwide income. However, you may qualify to exclude from income up to an amount of your foreign earnings that is adjusted annually for inflation. In addition, you can exclude or deduct certain foreign housing amounts.” For 2017, that amount is just over $100,000. So, if you make less than $100,000, you will not pay any US taxes. Second, if you make significantly more money than $100,000, and/or you don’t want to move very far, there is another very good option. And this other option may be one of the greatest locations in the world right now for tax efficiency. You can pay ZERO taxes if you move to Puerto Rico. It’s completely legal and you file your taxes annually with the IRS, just like you normally would… except you keep all of your money at the end of the year. There are, of course, a few catches. Here they are: You must live in Puerto Rico for more than half of the year.You pay 0% taxes on interest, dividends, and capital gains.Also, if you set your company up in Puerto Rico, you only pay 4% taxes on your yearly net profit. Now, that’s Puerto Rico just form a tax perspective. Let’s say that you are not a US citizen (and don’t care about this tax stuff)… there are incredible investment opportunities there right now. - We’re going there in April, if you want to join us.

There are many ways people become rich. Also, rich means different as per the individual. Some people view rich as having a positive net worth while some people think being rich is being a billionaire. However, to directly answer this question, one becomes rich by simply making, saving, and then investing that money properly that they make and save. Most people become rich over time. Think about the picture I included. If you invested your money and generated an annual return of 20% which is difficult but possible, you can turn $50k into over $70m in 40 years. That is also adding nothing with that initial $50k as well.  So if I were to give you advice, the first thing you want to do is learn to build income. Learn to build income by creating different income streams. The more sources of income you have, the better. I still count investing as income as well. So everyone that works one job can have at least two sources of income. Once you build income, save your money. It is better making $50k and saving $20k per year than making $100k and saving $10k per year. And once you save, invest that money right away. Inflation silently keeps the middle class from becoming wealthy if they do not invest. When you invest, learn to do it properly. Don’t take on risk as much when you are older. If you are young, feel free to take on risk. Be diverse as well no matter what age. With investing, it is usually the most patient that wins, and not the most eager to make money. Don’t expect to get rich overnight.  Now, there are ways to get rich quick, like somehow building a miracle app and getting millions of downloads and suddenly becoming a multimillionaire maybe a year later. It is possible, but much harder than just investing like the example above. Ask most wealthy people, and they made their money thanks to compounding interest and earning a decent income or better most of their life. Few people built billion-dollar companies. But, I am not discouraging you. You should actually try anything. So yes, people get rich through many different ways. Some even do it illegally which I advise not to do obviously. Making money illegal is wrong. Many people can build wealth in real estate as well. Some people hit the lottery. Some are NBA players. It all varies, but again, investing over time is very common compared to other ways to get rich. So there you have it. Also, check out my profile if you want to learn more about investing and increase your financial IQ.

I'll give a more fundamental answer than a lot of people on here.  You want to be rich. That means "having a lot of money". If you want to have a lot of money you have to get it from somewhere. Where is the only place you can get it? From people who already have it. So how do you get them to give it to you?  Barring crime the most consistent way is to offer them something in return, it's an exchange. So you need to start by having something to offer to them, which you'll convince them to give you money in exchange for. Convincing people they want something is hard so the easiest way is to offer them something they already want.  In other words offer people something they are already buying that way you just have to convince them to buy it from you rather than someone else, which you can do by being cheaper, more convenient, offering better service, a better guarantee, etc. A lot of people talk about "add value" but don't really define what that means. What it means is offer something a little better for what they are getting than someone else, that differential is the value you're offering. In the aggregate of you're offering more value you'll get more business provided you can market as well.  Now, you can get someone to give you billions and still be broke if it costs you as much to sell it to the person as they pay you for it so what you've got to do is learn to keep costs low, buy things for way less than they are worth/sell for. I'd aim to find something that sells for 4-5 times what it costs you if possible as a place to start, information products are a good place to start.  You can buy something cheap and sell it for fair market value though and not get rich though. To be rich you don't just need to make money, you need to make a lot of money and you do that by being able to sell a lot of something. To do this you need two things: 1. Lots of buyers (or big buyers) - in other words find a good sized market  2. Enough quantity at a good deal to service a big enough part of the market - hint, get away from selling your time, you can only sell so much of it. You could sell the time of someone else buy there are more moving parts in there so usually selling products or digital goods/services/information is the easiest to scale though there are lots of other options this is usually the easiest place to start  In order to do this consistently it usually helps to be an expert in what you're selling and the market for what you're selling so dedicate yourself to that mastery.  Apply this process consistently and grind it out and you'll get there.  To recap: - find something with a decent sized market that you can buy for substantially less than the market price  - give a competitive offer to the people who are already buying this stuff  - keep your spending low so you accumulate as much of the difference as possible  - grow it as big as you can Hope that helps.  Michael Rosmer www.richucation.com

There are many paths to wealth, spiritual and physical wealth. I've gotten much satisfaction in both through being in real estate brokerage and investment. The key is knowing who you are, your strengths and weaknesses. What you are not expert at you can hire someone who is or partner with someone who has those strengths you lack. Choose your path based on your interests and your reason(s) you like being on the planet. This makes you realize that you want wealth for a bigger purpose: your family, church, community, cause...something more than just your personal consumption. People come before anything. Put your priorities in order. People, Product and Profit in that order. I try to live with the Golden Rule, treat others as you would want to be treated.  Then, you need Goal(s), a Plan to attain those Goal(s), Strategies to implement the Plan, and Tactics to implement your strategies. I think "luck" is being industrious while working on your Plan to attain your Goal(s) that is opportunity. If you want to make money of course you need to build your goals around something the world will pay you for...sometimes that is apparent, sometimes not. Taking risk by building something new and untried has the highest risk for failure and the highest reward potential. You get to choose. You can gain wealth through old line industry like real estate, or try something as wild as AOL was in the early days of its existence when Steve Case was involved. Play to your heart and stick to the Plan and you should do well, providing you live within your means and don't squander your assets.

Becoming Rich Is Your Essential Responsibility..  Everyone is seriously interested to become rich.. But, very few take this a responsibility.. You have two options to become rich.. Simple and easy.. which most people wish and try to do..Read this story… Lisa bought a donkey from a farmer for £100.  The farmer agreed to deliver the donkey the next day. In the morning he drove up and said ... 'Sorry , but I have some bad news. The donkey died.' Lisa replied, 'Well just give me my money back then.' The farmer said, 'Can't do that. I've already spent it.' Lisa said, ' OK then, just bring me the dead donkey.' The farmer asked, 'What are you going to do with him?' Lisa said, 'I'm going to give him off in a lottery prize.' The farmer said, 'You can't do that with a dead donkey!' Lisa said, 'Sure I can. Watch me. I just won't tell anybody he's dead.' A month later, the farmer met up with Lisa and asked, 'What happened with that dead donkey?' Lisa said, 'I gave him off in a lottery. I sold 500 tickets at £2 each and made a profit of £898.' The farmer said, 'Didn't anyone complain?' Lisa said, 'Just the guy who won. So I gave him his £2 back.' Well, jokes apart.., In one way or the other, most of the people/ business houses apply the above strategy to become rich.. 2. The right way, but not the easier..! First and foremost., You should believe in yourself that you want to and is able to grow richer… A strong belief triggers the required energy that works wonders.. Then., Identify what you are best in.. Search and look for your own skills, abilities, shortcomings.. You are ‘best’ in something or the other for sure.. Start your work, job, business NOW.., no matter how small and insignificant it may look like.. Waiting for the ‘right opportunity’ is not going to take you anywhere.. Work for 15 hours every day.., each day.., and at least for a few years.. There is no relaxation in this.. Be willing to take ‘risks’.. Because, only such people who don’t hesitate to take risks are able to encounter richness.. Each day think about how you can further improvise your work, service, product.. This is the secret to your being successful.. Make sure you love and respect your work.. Do not worry about what profit you are earning, instead, focus entirely on making your service, product acceptable and likable by everyone connected.. If you are passionate about your work and if your priorities are not just making profit, but to make your service, product acceptable to all.., you will surely nail it.. Bottom Line: You can not do something to become rich.. but what and how you do things can always make you rich..! (Image Courtesy: Google Images)

Browsing around the magic world of Twitter this morning I run into something that got my attention: It was an article published by a Spanish newspaper about average and median income in Spain. So, apparently, the average yearly salary for a Spanish worker is around 16,000 euro. Only 17% of our population makes over 30k a year. And our top 1%, the highest income guy or gal of every 100, makes 95k a year. I used to live in Charlotte, North Carolina about a year ago. What do you think the numbers would be there? Well, the average salary in the United States is around 45k dollars (almost 30k more than in Spain). And the 1%? They make just shy of half a million dollars. But how about New York City, for example? The average salary is about 70k (not bad, huh), and the 1% makes OVER 600,000k. That’s a lot of money.  Just a couple weeks back I received a message on Quora from a guy in Nigeria. He was an amazing writer (probably better than myself), and he was telling me that the average YEARLY salary in his country was less than 4 thousand US dollars. Isn’t that crazy? Let’s keep digging? How about India, where the yearly salary is less than two thousand dollars? Or Kenya? Fifteen hundred dollars.   But what’s my point and why am I not telling you how to be rich? The truth is that if you are born in Europe, America, Australia/NZ, most parts of Asia, and many other regions in the world… you probably are rich already. Yes, you might not have that flaming lambo that you so want, but you have running water every time you go to the shower, right? And you eat three times a day? And you can buy books whenever you want? And you have a laptop? Yes, you are rich. And this is not a touchy-feely advice that tells you you have to be a hippy. Absolutely not. Go get yours if you want. But you just have to understand that the world does not end at the border of your state, your country, or even your continent. Be thankful for where you are, for what you have, and the opportunities you enjoy.  You should totally follow me here on Quora for more stuff like this. And check this out:Martí Sánchez's answer to How do entrepreneurs think?

I once asked my uncle, who retired at age 50, this question. He said, “Pranav, there are 4 ways to get rich.” I’m going to share them with you. ONE: You are born rich You have heard how some people are born with a silver spoon. Certainly, being born rich is the easiest way to become rich. TWO: Marry someone rich I have observed relatives and friends become rich overnight simply by marrying someone rich. This is not necessarily easy since people are always going to bad mouth you. You need a thick skin, and the ability to look beyond your partner’s wealth. Rich people, like anyone else, have dysfunctional families too. The wealth compounds the dysfunctionality, and money has been known to tear families apart. THREE: Get very lucky My uncle considered himself lucky and this is how he made his wealth. He bought a property at the right time and place. He told me that when he bought his first property - a house - he and his wife could not afford any furniture and they slept on the floor until they could afford a mattress. He expressed gratitude for being able to sell and buy a larger property several times, catching the property cycles at the right times. FOUR: Work very, very, very hard Yes, hard work can make you rich, but you have to work very, very, very hard. My uncle also said, “Pranav, your parents are not rich, so that's out for you. If you want to be rich, you must work very, very, very hard and get lucky or find yourself a rich girl.” I'm still working hard.

The Guaranteed Way to Get Rich I’m impressed by the diversity of answers to this question. The problem, however, is that for someone trying to find a guaranteed path to wealth, these diverse inputs only end up causing confusion. One advices you to start a dropshipping business while another tells you to invest in real estate. From Youtube to Amazon FBA there are literally a million ways to make a million dollars, each with its own trajectory, lifestyle, initial investments, workload, failure rates and so on. As an avid reader of business books, stories on how millionaires made their money, business models, income streams etc., I have compared all possible pathways to wealth to find which is the easiest, fastest and the most guaranteed way to become rich, which can be adopted by anyone irrespective of their age, financial situation or educational qualifications. So, without further ado, let me introduce you to the quickest (considering legal ones only), safest and comparitevely the easiest method to richness . It is called “The Wealth Triangle” and it was proposed by Canadian multi-millionaire entrepreneur Dan Lok.  It is the most efficient and effective roadmap to wealth and contains 3 steps: STEP 1: MONETIZING A HIGH-INCOME SKILL (you trade hours for dollars) Lok defines it as any skill which is fairly easy to learn, is in high demand and that which earns you over $10,000 a month. Note that it is a “skill” ,not a “high-income job” and does not require a degree. I’m sure you know that not every job is created equal. Your level of education or experience is irrelevent as the actual determinant of your salary in the eyes of the economy is simply supply and demand. Your Ph.D is worthless and your $100k/ yr job will vanish overnight if a machine/AI can replace you. However, there are some skills that are irreplacable and will always stay in high demand which results in a higher income. Like every other job, you trade your time in exchange for dollars but here, it is “high dollars”. Examples of high-income skills include copywriting, closing, social media marketing, SEO, UI/UX design, web design, youtube and so on. Heck, even if you have some weird niched talent and can make 10 grand a month with it, that could also be considered in this category. You will be self employed and can work on your own terms from any location around the world. I am a copywriter myself and if you don’t know what that means, let me tell you. When you visit a website that sells any form of products of services, the textual content is written by copywriters like me. Other high-income skills are given below:  You can learn these skills from courses or even youtube videos and blogs. This is the stage where you start earning a lot of money. During this stage, you should save most of your income. After some time, you slowly realise that despite working very profitable projects, you still have to exchange your time for money and that you cannot add more hours to the 24-hour clock to increase your earnings. Your earning are great but it can only be grown linearly. To grow your wealth exponentially, you need to slowly proceed to STEP 2. STEP 2: START A SCALABLE BUSINESS (you leverage business systems to work for you) A scalable business is one that does not require much infastructure and has the potential for becoming really large. If you start a restaurant business, you are tied down to its location and hence not scalable. Most scalable businesses are internet businesses but the list also includes software services, e-commerce etc. Another clever business idea is to sell digital products like courses teaching people about the high-income skill you posses from Step 1. All you have to do is record the material once and the rest needs no extra expenditure whether you sell thousands or millions of it. Scalable businesses have the potential to be sold for a very large sum of money. Although, you still have to spend a lot of time in your business, your income numbers are growing exponentially. To free up time inorder to enjoy your wealth, you have to build automated systems in your business so that it runs smoothly even without your involvement. I suggest you to read the book The Four-Hour Workweek by Tim Ferris to know more on how to manage a multi-million dollar business without even being present in it while you travel the world. STEP 3: INVEST IN HIGH RETURN INVESTMENTS (your money makes you more money) This is the final step of the process where you gain complete freedom. At this stage, you can either sell your company for a very large sum of money or keep it if it does not require your presence at all and has a high amount of cashflow. This large sum should be invested in a diverse portfolio of high return investments that ensure a steady cashflow and grows in capital. It is at this stage that your net worth increases. You also enjoy freedom as you don’t have to work anymore and you can use this oppurtunity to travel the world or do what you love. Well, why should I follow this path? I could simply raise a lot of money in loans and start a business directly without step 1. Here’s why: 9 out of every 10 businesses fail in the first year itself. No matter how great you think your product or service is, there is no guarantee when it comes to business. But the great thing here is that even if your business fails, you still have a high income skill to fall back on. You won’t be affected in a major way and your lifestyle expenses will be met as usual. Your previous experience and contacts can still be used to resume your high-income career. You won’t have to pay back anything to anybody since your business was not started through debt. You can see a lot of people who fall into the trap of mortgaging their homes to start a business and ultimately fail, losing everything in the process. On the contrary, when you are’nt worried about failure, you are not under a lot of stress or pressure. This improves your productivity as well as mental well-being.High-income skills open doors to the inner workings of different industries and teach you valuable skills that are required for running a business. This could be negotiation skills, communication skills, competitior research and so on. Another thing is that the contacts you’ve gained can be leveraged when starting your business.It exposes you to the various pain points in different industries and can spark great business ideas within you.You can manage to operate your business at a loss to grow quicker and beat out the competition due to your high-income earnings.Due to all these reasons, I think that the Wealth Triangle is the most guaranteed yet quickest way to wealth. Thank you for reading. I am Joel and I’ll see you in another answer. P.S I’m new to Quora. Your upvotes and followings are highly appreciated Thank u

Two forces that a lot of people underestimate by a wide margin:1) The power of compounding2) The power of leverage (both operational and financial leverage) The power of compoundingIf you invest your money at a 10% annual return, you basically double your money every 7 years. That means if you start with 100K$ that you saved during your first career years, you would end up with 200K$ 7 years after; 400K$ 14 years after; 800K$ 21 years after and so on... Obviously, most people have no idea that compounding is so powerful, otherwise, there would be a much bigger amount of compounders... The power of leverageAll rich people understand that they need to incorporate some form of leverage to compound at a faster rate. Take for example Warren Buffett at Berkshire Hathaway, his insurance subsidiaries collect premiums before rendering any insurance services, leaving him a massive float of money that he can invest for his shareholders before he has to pay any coverage. Some people invest in equipments that are going to deliver sustainable revenues in exchange for an upfront fixed cost. Take for example an automatic printer that would print business cards super fast. Well, that machine might cost 250K$ upfront but once you've got it up running, you can deliver more business cards while the machine has become a fixed cost, thus, leaving you with margin expansion if you can grow revenues. Revenues goes up while expenses stay partly fixed. That is the power of operational leverage. Other people use financial leverage to get rich. Real Estate investors are known for doing it. They take 4$ of debt for every dollar of equity and buy a commercial or residential property that is going to leave them with a stable, predictable and slightly growing cashflow. In fact, most people say that their house was their best investment ever... What they do not know is that the house hasn't made them so much money but the financial leverage they took on when making their buy decision made them a lot. Houses do not go up in price by much (probably around 5% per year) and when you add up all taxes paid annually, it's really not the big thing! But, when you take on leverage, it's much different. Take for example a 250K$ house that you buy with only 25K$ equity at start. If the house value goes up by 5% the first year, it's 12,5K$ up pre-interests on an equity investment of 25K$, that's a 50% return. Leverage and compounding aren't really secret it's just that most people don't bother it and do not ask themselves how they could make more money while rich people do.

Save - unsexy, but it has to be done. Minimum 40% of income.Cashflow - this could be a job, or business.Invest - whatever is left after you’ve put your 40% under the bed, you invest in things that are LOW risk, HIGH return. The lower the risk, the higher the return, the better - of course. Don’t let anyone tell you that such investments don’t exist. ‘Risk’ isn’t absolute - its personal and subjective.Re-invest - profit should be reinvested back into income-generating infrastructure - such as a business, or other investments. If you have a job, want to create a personal brand, or are self-employed, this profit could be re-invested into learning new skills, or marketing yourself to high-paying companies.Seek out good information - mainstream media is highly processed information that is uninvestable. To catch trends early, you have to be prepared to look beyond the herd mentality.Cultivate self-discipline - there is a direct relationship between impulse control and wealth. More impulse control = higher earning potential. Audit your diet, exercise, sexual activities, and work out where and - more importantly - why your self-control breaks down.Practice being wealthy - many are unprepared for wealth when it happens to them. Then they give it all away, because they don’t feel it should belong to them. Visit car showrooms and houses that you would purchase if you were ultra-wealthy. Change your habits, language and thoughts to align with the person the person you want to be.Surround yourself with other wealthy people. You become the company you keep.Eat cat food - STAY AWAY from all forms of debt: mortgages, credit cards etc. They are for plebs and ultimately they play upon the public’s low impulse control. Self-discipline is the ability to live as though you’re broke, so that your financial inventory isn’t wasted on temporary pleasure and status symbols. Be prepared to live like you’re broke for decades. Cold showers, same clothes, single beds, public transport.Why? - why do you want ultra-wealth? Is it for ‘freedom’? Is it to ultimately help others? Is it to buy out and destroy whaling ships in order to save the dolphin and whale populations? Is it to develop technology that could quickly remove plastic from the oceans? Is it ‘just because’? Asking yourself why will give the path meaning and motivation.

I wrote a below piece more than 3 years ago. I got some interesting results following those steps. (See at the end)  To become wealthy you need your own business. It’s an axiom. Wages are my hobby. In my country only 2% of the population earns more than $3k per month. And they are almost exclusively managers and business owners. There are very, very few specialists among those 2% and most of them earn just a little above $3k. The higher you go on the wages ladder, the fewer managers you can find and the more entrepreneurs there are. And at some high enough point there are no specialists. In the USA the level of “no specialists” point is higher, but the rule is the same – if you want to get big bucks you need to own a business. I have no idea how to launch a successful business. I’m a lifelong employee. My grandparents were farmers. My mom is a housewife and my dad is a lifelong employee, too. He started his own business twice and failed twice. The most successful entrepreneur I know is my uncle. His company survived for about 20 years. He has a dozen employees, a flat, a house, a few cars and was forced to get $30k credit to maintain financial liquidity last year. So I don’t know what it takes to succeed in business.What is more, my mindset is an employee’s mindset. I don’t BELIEVE I can earn more than 4$k a month in the same way I don’t believe I can fly to the moon. It’s NOT possible! However.There were people who started where I did and achieved an enormous success. Jim Rohn at the age of 25 was employed and broken. At the age of 31 he was a millionaire.Bob Proctor was a broken employee at the age of 24. He set himself a goal to earn a $4k next year and he earned $170k. And there are more of such cases. It’s possible to get rich. If they could do it, then there is some way I can do it too. A way you can do it.The formulas for getting rich are different for each person, there is no sure way to success or most of us would already be wealthy and happy.But there are some common traits.  1. First of them is Faith.Some says you have to believe in yourself, but that’s not true. At least it isn’t true in every case. Jim Rohn had little to none self doubts. But Bob Proctor says he didn’t believe he could earn those $4k, he only believed that his mentor certainly believed that it’s possible. So Proctor believed in his mentor’s faith. Wallace D. Wattles, a New Age author, recommended believing that the universe is build from the basic thinking substance, which is friendly to any progress and which you can influence by a power of thought. If you think that’s preposterous – think again. At least a few modern millionaires credit part of their success to his book – The Science of Getting Rich. Blessed Jan Beyzym didn’t believe in himself at all. He knew he was nothing more than one of the worst sinners on Earth. But he believed he is a tool in God’s hand. He was able to achieve worldly success basing on this faith. So Faith is one of elements of success. 2. Vision is another one.If you have heard about a man or woman who claims that dreams, goals and visualization was not necessary to reach their successes, please refer me to them. It will be the first such testimonial I encountered. Jim Rohn was one of the most down to earth persons in the world. He mocked the idea of personal affirmation more than once. But when it went to goals he had always been advising to see and feel the results in your mind when setting them. Wallace D. Wattles set personal vision as the first and central element of getting rich process. Jan Beyzym wrote in his letters, that closing the eyes he can see the hospital for the lepers he wanted to build, clearly in his mind. 3. Work is the last component.It hasn’t to be hard work. It hasn’t to be a grand one. It has to be incessant. Jim Rohn said he became a millionaire in 6 years, because he consistently did easy things. His definition of easy: something you can do. Wallace D. Wattles went even further with his mystical inclinations – he advised just to work with your vision in mind. No matter what you do, you will reach its realization one day, if you work every day having your dream in mind. Once again – don’t ridicule him, some millionaires claim it works. Jan Beyzym did something similar in fact. He tirelessly worked on making the life of his lepers more bearable, he fed them, he medicated them, he tended their wounds, he prayed for them and with them. And between those mundane tasks he had been writing hundreds of letters to donors. He appealed to the government for resources and did a bunch of other things to make his dream come true. Faith, Vision and Work.The ratios of each may be different for you, but all of them are essential. So I urge you to formulate your dream, to find a faith in something inflexible, whatever is inflexible for you – God, yourself, your spouse, your friends, your mentor – and to lay down a way to work on your dream every single day. In my modest opinion this is the way to get the results.  Originally posted on ExpandBeyondYourself.com in October 2013  Post Scriptum 3 years later I started my own venture. I’m authorpreneur. I have several streams of income, but the main bulk are books royalties. Since writing the above post my income grew 86%. In December 2016 I earned $4,000 for first time ever. In fact, I earned more than that, but over $4k came from my books only. It appears I can fly to the moon ;)

Habits that can make you rich Everyone wants to be rich in life. Does everyone become rich? The truth is that everyone wants to be rich but really fail to plan and think outside the box. There is no get rich quick system, it is a process that takes time, patience and continuous effort to build wealth. If you want to build wealth, you have to start with your habits. The rich and successful people regularly follow certain habits. Small habits can get you pretty far in acquiring wealth. If you learn to adopt these habits early in life, you can also have a shot at achieving wealth and success in life. Here are 7 habits that can make you rich 1. Set Some Goals Setting goals gives you a sense of direction and boosts your motivation and self confidence. Wishing will not bring riches, so set some goals and track your your progress towards your goals at regular intervals  2. Build up Multiple Sources of Income Most of us rely on one source of income but rich people have more than one source of income. 3. Save and Invest Money Always spend less than you earn. Start learning the habit of saving money and concentrate on saving as much as you can. Make it a habit to save at least 50% of every pay raise. 4. Surround Yourself with Successful People The people we spend our time with have a great impact on our lives. We are only as successful as the people we associate with 5. Take Risks Everyone wants to be rich, but they do not want to take risks. Becoming rich is not easy. Becoming rich means you require to take risks, work long hours or make sacrifices. 6. Stay Focused and Positive When you set some goals, you feel confident and energized but this fades away after some tome when you fail to stay focused and positive on your goals. Successful people always stay focused and positive on their goals.   7. Read Everyday Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body - Joseph Addison. Rich and successful people are avid readers and the reason they read is to improve themselves. Adopt just one of above mentioned habits is all to take yourself out of your current circumstances. If you want to be rich in life you have to change your habits and the choices you have made. Just adopt the above mentioned habits as a template for achieving wealth and success in life.

Sell T-Shirts. No, seriously. Meet Jason Sadler. Jason is a creative entrepreneur through-and-through. After a brief stint in the corporate cubicle, he decided to jump ship and work for himself. He became the happy co-owner of a successful web design firm in Florida and was making good money. But then he had his ‘aha’ moment. You know exactly what I’m talking about. The idea you can’t stop thinking about. The one you annoy your parents or your friends about. That was Jason. “A new idea popped into my head. An idea that eventually would consume my thoughts day in and day out. An idea that was all I wanted to talk about and all I wanted to focus my energy on. I wanted to get paid to wear T-shirts.” Timeout…paid to wear t-shirts? What the hell is this guy talking about? Jason was very serious and wasn’t going to stop until he sold out the space on his chest.  On January 1, 2009, Jason started The Story of IWearYourShirt and How I Made $1,000,000 Wearing T-Shirts (IWYS) and became a walking billboard for any company crazy enough to pay him. He “charged his first client, Streaming & Online Video Services | IBM Cloud Video, $1 to wear a branded T-shirt. On Jan. 2, he charged the next company $2. On the 114th day of 2008, he charged a company $114 to wear their T-shirt, and so on, until Dec. 31, when he pocketed $365. At that point, he had accumulated $70,000.” Year 1 sold out in just six months, and brands poured in for space on Jason’s chest. By 2012, IWYS had raised prices significantly and was bringing in $500,000 in annual revenue. Inventory was tight (literally), so Jason hired four other shirt wearers to rep businesses from Starbucks to Pizza Hut. By the time Jason wore his last sponsored tee, in May 2013, IWYS had generated over $1,000,000 in advertising revenue from more than 1,600 businesses across the country. His story was told by The Today Show, CBS Evening News, and Fortune Magazine, and he even published a book on IWYS’ journey titled Creativity For Sale. Just think about that for a second. This man created a million-dollar business by wearing t-shirts and posting about the experience. No product. No business plan. Just a ridiculous idea and a whole lot of grit. As you might have guessed, IWYS was just the beginning of Jason’s eccentric entrepreneurial journey. In 2012, Sadler auctioned the rights to—wait for it—his last name to the highest bidder. Headsets: Plantronics, Wireless, USB, Computer & Phone Office Headsets paid $45,000. So for a year, Jason Sadler became Jason HeadsetsDotCom. We wish I was kidding.  If you like mind-blowing business stories like Jason’s, you’ll love Morning Brew’s daily email newsletter. Seriously, check it out. Source: Morning Brew

Let’s start by defining what you mean by being rich. Do you want to own your own company? How much per month do you want to earn? If you were rich, what would you do? How would you know if you were rich? Where would you like to live? What would you invest in? What kind of car would you drive? What kind of house would you live in? What is your current occupation? If you were rich, would you continue doing that? If not, what would you do? Why do you want to be rich? You see, the first step is defining your target wealth and why that is important to you. Just saying you want a bunch of money doesn’t define what a bunch is to you. Disliking where you are at in life isn’t sufficient motivation either. You will find that if you sacrifice your honesty or integrity anywhere along the line, the riches you accumulate won’t buy those back for you. There is an old proverb, “If you help enough other people to get what they want, you can get anything you want.” Who do you care about besides yourself? Who would you like to help? What do you see as your purpose in life? These are all critical questions. The fact is that if your only concern is for yourself, there are not many people who will help you get what you want. What is in it for them? Supposing I could teach you what to do, and how to think, to become rich, would you really listen? Are you coachable? If your answer is yes, I might be able to work with you. Being rich is relative. But if you are talking about how to have an ample amount of money then here are few tips by which you can fullfill your desire. Spend less- You are poor not because you earn less amount of money. You are poor because you spend more. Decide an amount which shall not be exceeded by you every month. Note down every expenditure you make. This will help you spend less.Bank account with no withdrawal option- Keep multiple bank accounts but there should be one account where you only deposit money but don't withdraw anything. Don't keep any Debit Card for that account. Keep away the cheque book. Use it only when it's emergency.Invest- Be a good investor of your money. Atleast 10% of your earning should be invested. Whether it's a mutual fund or a business, you should learn the art of investing. Read Intelligent investor to know more about investment which brings me to number 4.Read books- Yes, you can spend money on books to earn more money. Books are knowledge, knowledge is a weapon which will make you rich. Read books like Intelligent Investor, the Power of habit, Think and grow richer and many more.Learn to multitask - You need to do more in order to get more. When you start to get comfortable in one work go for another work and perform both of them but (obviously) don't screw both of them up. If you are not able to handle both then don't do it.Buy essentials on sale- Things like toothpaste, washing powder, shampoo, cooking essentials, soap, these are daily essentials. Buy them in a bunch when they are on sale. It will save you a lot of money.Have a routine - Make a list of essential things that you need to do the next day. Make sure you tick every one of those things before you go to sleep at night on that day. Having a good routine will help you do that.Substitute restaurant with Gym/Sport- You need to stay healthy and fit to work more. Avoiding restaurants will save you a lot of money which you can invest on gym or any sports activity to keep yourself fit.Patience- Have patience. It's not a gamble, money won't come overnight. Keep working, love your work and work in the right way. Money will definitely come.Stop procrastinating, implement your idea right now- Ideas are easy but implementation is difficult. If you think that your idea can make you a millionaire or a billionaire then why are you waiting ? You are thinking about starting tomorrow ? Or next week ? Are you still waiting for a perfect time to start ? Or a good investment ? These are all excuses that will never let you start. You should start right now. Keep your short term goals and long term goals written somewhere. Keep reaching your short term goals. Accept failures. You will soon find a path. Read books, learn from the internet. You will definitely reach your long term goal.I am also one of you who is expecting to get 'Rich' one day. I am also following the things that I have mentioned, specially number 10. I was a procrastinator a year ago but I have already decided to go ahead with my idea.

I think many people have missed the point and are propagating myths. Let me take the contrarian view to break the myths: Invest for high returns: But who is going to give you high returns? The bank? The stock Market? Your local businessman? Why would someone just give you high returns just because you invested with them. Whats it it for them? Investing your money is therefore always a risk. Higher the risk to your principal, higher the possibility of decent return. That is a standard finance concept! Someone has already made a lot of money by lending money - Morgans for example by taking a lot of risk on their money. Therefore, a well established, well regulated and trustworthy financial system is necessary to ensure the safety of principal and it can promise average return at best. Invest in yourself: That is a good idea for sure. But have you ever wondered how many centuries of work has gone into discovering, distilling and perfecting the information into readily usable form? When you read in a physics or mathematics book, the concepts are readily applicable to create something tangible. So how can some one afford to give all that information in less than $100? Someone therefore has made a lot of money when he invented/discovered those concepts. Thomas Alva Edison did not just invent the light bulb. He sold hundreds and thousands of them through the company he established - General Electric (GE)! Therefore government support is necessary to fund research and give away the information cheaply. Start a scalable business: It is again a good idea for sure. But what makes your business more successful than a corner store. Do you even have the experience. The guy who runs the corner store probably has more business experience and acumen than you. It is usually the first mover advantage that makes a scalable business lot of money. But what if your business does not take off? Remember that 90% of all businesses fail within the first 5 years. Use the power of compounding: How do you make use of the power of compounding? Somebody has to pay you compound interest on your money for a lot of years right? Can you find someone who will agree to do that?

The best kept secret to becoming rich is, in my opinion, that in addition to building up big income and investing it, you must build up an asset that you will eventually sell at a big multiple of earnings. So you get a triple return on your work: 1. high income 2. the extra income by always living on less than you earn, and invest the rest, and re-invest the earnings of your investments. 3. THE BEST KEPT SECRET TO BECOMING RICH: Your big payday when you sell the business for 3, 5, 8 or even 10 times its annual net income. So you want to own a business you can ultimately sell for the big payday. The big cashout. That’s how you become rich. #1 and #2 are not secret. But gearing things for a big payday by selling at a multiple of earnings is the real secret. It’s the ultimate in leverage. To get rich you need leverage. If you buy a property, the mortgage gives you leverage. If you buy a $100,000 property with $20,000 down and $80,000 mortgage, and say the rent pays the bills and the mortgage and gives you s cash return annually. Great. If the property goes up 10%, to $110,000, you haven’t made 10%. YOu’ve made $10,000 with equity of only $20,000. That’s a 50% return. The leverage also comes from the multiple of earnings that the marketplace considers appropriate for that kind of income-earning asset. If the going capitalization rate is say, 6%, that means that a property that makes annual net operating income (NOI) (it’s before dealing with mortgage payments) of $6,000, is worth $100,000. So if you raise rents $10 per month, that’s $120 per annum in increased NOI. That means that your property is now worth $120/.06=$2,000. If you do that in the 3 units you have in the property, ie raise each one $10 per month, assuming expenses haven’t changed, then you have thereby increased your net worth by 3 X $2,000=$6,000. In a business context, the business might sell for 3X annual net income. Or, 5 X. So if you increase the earnings by $50,000 per annum, you have not only made yourself $50,000 more per year, which you can pay tax on, and invest the rest, you have increased the sale value of the business by say, $50,000 X 4=$200,000. The extra $50,000 got translated into $200,000. Also, when you sell out, your gain is a capital gain and it’s usually taxed at a lower rate than the annual earnings. So that’s another adjunct to the best kept secret. You’re turning income into a multiple of capital, and you’re saving income tax on that gain.

Massive wealth comes from building businesses from scratch that become wildly successful. While this is a proven formula, most of us aren’t Steve Jobs or Elon Musk. So here are 5 things that anyone can do to dramatically increase their wealth: Earn additional income through doubling down on your job efforts or building extra income with a side hustle. There are dozens of ideas for side incomes and whole books written on the topic. Given that the average North American watches 30 hours of TV a week, it looks like just about everyone can free up the time to do it.Track your net worth. Very simple. What you own minus what you owe. People often say that they want to become rich but don’t measure how they are doing. Start tracking your net worth - look at it monthly for 6 months, then quarterly thereafter. You will see things very differently. More on this here. You can download a simple free spreadsheet to get started here.Slash expenses. Marketers are incredibly sophisticated at separating you from your cash. Stay out of malls, buy what you need. Shop around for every purchase of consequence. Never shop for the sake of shopping. Look at borrowing things, buying things used or doing without. The “fun” of shopping is short-lived and the interests and payments live on forever. Pay particular attention to recurring monthly expenses. In Cashflow Cookbook, I gathered the 60 best ideas to do this. The book is a simple way to check to see if you have covered the major ideas. Learn more here. You can also follow my blog posts with innovative ways to save on everything here. Know what percentage of your income you save or set aside for debt repayment. Set a goal to increase that by 5% within 3 months. Start working on initiatives to get there. Then set a new goal for another 5%.Get your money working for you. Through additional earning and reduced expenses, you can free up cash to pay down debt or increase your contributions to your savings and investment. This is very powerful. Freeing up $100/month and investing the money at 7% for 10 years will get you an additional $17,300 in net worth. Keep it going for 10 more years and you will have $52,100. Doing this for 30 years will get you $122,000. Invest in a well diversified handful of exchange traded funds. If you invest in individual stocks, be sure you look at ones that are positioned for growth in the new economy. More on that here. If you need help, find a well qualified and recommended financial advisor.Learn everything you can about money, saving and investing. Take your first $25 of monthly savings from step 3 and buy a good personal finance or investing book each month and read it cover to cover. Reread each of them every 6 months or so to internalize the ideas. Yes, you can afford $25 a month. Worse case borrow them from your local library.With these simple steps you can retire with many times the wealth of the average North American. Once you build wealth, give back to your community, help others and make the most of your new-found freedom.

Aside from inheriting money or inventing something and keeping the patent or doing something illegal: the honest, real, most consistent best way to become rich is to work hard, perhaps even two jobs early in life, then SAVE and INVEST your money. EVERY dime you can get. You will not get rich quick, you will get rich slow. Go to any site which offers compound interest calculations, or use a financial calculator, and look at what $5000.-$10,000. per year saved does over time even at a modest 5%. You will have to take some risk. Can’t have your money in a savings account paying less than 1%, it makes compounding ineffective. And, you must avoid taxes and brokerage fees as much as possible, they can quickly knock your net return down so low, that again your compounding does no good. Rental properties may be a good option for you once you have the down payment money, but you need a cushion before going into them- if they are vacant for a while, you still have to make the mortgage payments. I learned more about this from failures than from successes. I LOST a LOT of money trying to “get rich quick”. Most of my friends and family never got rich at all, really did not try. They just bought whatever their paychecks would permit and never invested. But a few, just a few, did what I mentioned earlier- invested wisely, pinched pennies, and now they can afford anything they want, decades later. Only downside to the long term “get rich slow” paradigm is that you do run the risk of dying before you ever get to enjoy your wealth. Only you can make a decision on that.

Success is a state of mind. Money is a side effect of success. "We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them." - Albert Einstein Dream big and have a vision. White down the why behind your goal. This should be meaningful to you. Try with more things until you hit a home run. You need to get inspired by your goal. Your goal should be a mission to serve, to make a difference. Otherwise you are not going to take action. This is the process that will inspire you to take action. It will come naturally as an idea or an urge to do something towards your goal. Invest in yourself first. Read every moment you are free. If you cannot read, listen to audio books. After you read take action and apply the knowledge. Value your time and value the knowledge. Your life should be a continuous cycle of learning and applying. Real education starts after university. Open your eyes and explore your environment. Ideas are everywhere. The problem is not the lack of a business idea. The problem is usually fear and lack of confidence. Try working on that first. We don’t actually do the things we want to do, we do the things we believe we can do. The apparent lack of a business idea is just an excuse for non-action, not a root cause for failure. If we don’t believe we can do it, we just postpone it and come up with excuses to justify our non-action. The problem is not the skill and not the capability, it's the mind. The lack of skill is a direct effect of the blocking disempowering mind. A successful mind will eventually master business execution and stay committed to the higher vision. The moment you stop being afraid of failure, your confidence grows. Experiencing failure first hand sometimes helps alleviate the fear of failure. In order to conquer fear, you need to face it. The root cause of fear and lack of confidence: The social conditioning related to the fear of failure happens during school, up to university. Failure to take an exam is seen as the ultimate individual failure, in a system that promotes individual achievement. After 20 years of conditioning, your mind is programmed in a certain way. If you are "lucky enough" to be six figures in student debt as well, welcome to a world of financial bondage and conformity. The perfect tool to kill your entrepreneurial dreams. When you fail, you grow and learn valuable lessons. Don’t be afraid to fail. Stay committed to the process, not a specific idea. Ideas are everywhere, just do something you are passionate about. That will increase your chances of success. Be lean, flexible and pivot. Follow the money and listen closely. The market will guide you towards success. You only have to make it big once to achieve your goal, so keep at it until you do. It’s not what is happening that’s relevant but our internal dialog about it. The problem with that is the social conditioning. We were conditioned to quickly label things and tasks and not to really think constructively about them. That’s what makes them monotonous. The industrial revolution created "robotic mindsets" focus mainly on fulfilling pointless and repetitive tasks. A direct effect of that was a generalized creative thought atrophy: Some years ago, the late Nobel prize-winning Dr. Albert Schweitzer was asked by a reporter, “Doctor, what’s wrong with men today?” The great doctor was silent a moment, and then he said, “Men simply don’t think!” - Earl Nightingale, The Strangest Secret (1956) The findings showed: 2% of the people think, 3% of the people think they think and 95% of the people would rather die than think. If you don't believe those numbers I challenge you next weekend to just sit down and think creatively for 8 hours. After 1 hour you wish you would be working.

Getting wealthy in the U.S. has very few secrets to it but your mind set needs be altered if it hasn’t grasped one concept. “The game is the game. It was here long before you came and will be here long after you are gone. You will not change this game but if you are able to understand it and become a good player in it you will be a winner.” It will come with a million little decisions you make early on that become larger later in life. To be given the best odds to stay out of poverty (90% chance)you only need to do 4 things starting out. Don’t get addicted to a substance, do get a high school education, don’t have children out of wedlock and do get a job. You have to look at this as a game with rules. Capitalism is a supply and demand driven puzzle that sets prices and everything is based on not just the median income but median effort, median mind set and median focus. If you work harder, faster, smarter than the guy next to you…you will have more than him. If you look at money as freedom with the more you have equals the more you have, then spending it becomes more difficult and saving it seeps in like some consistent effort in self preservation. If all of your decisions should be based on the long game and not on immediate gratification as money should be valuable than anything it can buy…now you have the proper mind set for the game. 80% of the millionaires and billionaires in this country are first generation so it is a learned and not born into undertaking. Just like going from fat to fit or village idiot to sage, you must make all your decisions with the end in mind. “Trust is huge!” You have to believe that all of the sacrifice, learning, ungodly hours put in and challenges overcome will pay off later. I can tell you from personal experience that it does…I didn’t go to college because a single mom couldn’t afford it. Started working full time right out of high school as a catering waiter and added jobs to that along the way. My record week was 128hrs when I was 22, worked a graveyard shift full time and took every shift I could get during the day. When I was at work, I worked my ass off to get noticed as someone that could move up and was promoted often. I learned more game theory along the way and figured out that I will not be young forever and my money could work 24/7/365 which is something I could not. Studied the stock market and real estate before I invested in either… today I go in the office only because it is who I have become and I enjoy working on something other than my golf swing. Good Luck in your chosen route and give it everything!

So you want to be rich?  What does that mean to you? Does that mean $10,000,000 in net worth or does that mean $1,000,000 a year in actual income. Regardless there are a couple steps you must take.  Surround yourself with rich people.  You are the average of the 5 people you surround yourself with. So surround yourself with rich people. Simple enough right? The reason you want to surround yourself with these people are the many benefits you can accumulate from them. Simply by being around them you'll be able to pick up on how they did it. What methods did they use? Did they start a tried and true business or go into something more innovative? Did they do it purely by grinding and working hard or by pure intellect and creativity? The more you're around rich people you more you learn that there are different ways to get there and that your mileage will vary.. a lot.  Learn a skill intensely. Even if its being a jack of all trades.  Making money and becoming rich is a function of value. More value, more money (generally) so you must develop a technique for generating value. Hedge fund managers do so by predicting the markets, sales people do it by getting people to purchase the product and software engineers do it by building a product. No matter what you plan to do you must be able to bring value. So find the area or areas in your life which you have a comparative advantage and pursue that whole heartedly. When you begin to develop value you're begin to develop riches.  Work hard. Very very hard.  The only people to every become rich by not working hard are the people who were handed it through the lottery or inheritance. You will not be able to be rich unless you're working hard. This goes hand in hand with my point above. Lets say you can produce 1 piece of value an hour. If you only work 40 hours a work, well you only produce 40 pieces of value. That just won't cut it. So you must work hard at honing your craft (getting that 2,10,100 pieces of value an hour) and/or producing more of that value (50,60,70 hours a week). Regardless you're going to have to work hard and grind while you can to be able to reach your dreams of being rich.  By surrounding yourself with the people you want to be like, developing a skill which produces lots of value and then working extremely hard towards your goal: you'll become rich one day.

Stop caring about money, and start caring about other people. I was listening to Tony Robbins Podcast the other day, you know, Tony Robbins, the guy with 30+ companies and billions of dollars. Tony said the reason why he is where he is today is because of his mindset and actions towards others: serve, give, and help others. Having a service and giving mindset will far outweigh any other advice I could give you. In action this might look like this: You get a job. For a concrete example, let’s say you maintain people’s lawns - either you are a lawnmower, a trimmer, a landscaper, a flower person, something.There are a few mindsets you could have when you go to work:I’m just here to collect my paycheck and I don’t really care about my work and how it looksI’m here to impress my boss so I’ll get a raise and then I can make more moneyI’m here to serve my company and the companies’ clients so that the company will get more work and I will have more work, which will lead to more money for me.The third option will lead to the first and second options, but so few people actually have the mindset of the third case. You start a company, something in the retail (product) spaceYou could come up with a crappy product and sell it to people and make some money that isn’t sustainableYou want money, don’t really care about people, so you just want to take their money and if a crappy product can do that, then that’s how you’ll do it.You could invest in making a great product that many people love and want, which would be sustainableYou want to help people, and by bringing a fantastic product to the marketplace, you are.Providing value through your service to others will help you become rich. Be a giver, serve others, and they will repay you for your efforts.

Most people who are millionaires are people who have invented something or started some kind of company. If you truly want to be rich, research some people who have done it and figure out what made them a success. Most of the time it is a combination of hard work, recognizing good opportunities, avoiding bad opportunities, taking advantage of natural talents and being persistent. Also, they tend to be resilient- they keep trying even when people tell them they can't or when they make mistakes or have failures. Proper money management is the key. Most people have the means, they just blow their money before the money can work for them. To make money work, you have to save some for that purpose. That means a tight budget which has a portion - 20% is a worthy amount, devoted to "investments". These investments can be varied. The key is learning to live on the other portion. There are almost no wives that look at an investment account with $100k in it and don't think, "Hey, I need a trip to Fiji or a new BMW." So just about the time you start getting an amount that can do some real investing, something happens or more specifically someone happens to your investments.   If your parents aren't rich the chances of you becoming super rich are very small. Bill Gates was in line to inherit a fortune before he did the Microsqueesh thing. When your parents can bank roll pretty much any adventure, including a stint at Harvard, you can actually focus on leading edge science and businesses focused on that realm. However, if you are interested, the next big business is in the forming stages. Robotics. The military is going gang busters on getting remotely piloted vehicles, airplanes and sensors. Practical applications, like home vaccums are coming to the market. Personal robots are driving the google mobile. Robotics will be bigger than it is right now and will virtually explode in the coming decades. Knowing how to do robotics will not suck in our collective future

There are essentially at least 3 tried and tested ways to achieve this: Inherit a reasonable amount of money at a decent enough age and compound itStart investing early enough. Small amounts and get rich slowlyStart your own businessOr do a combination of 2 or 3 of them. Like start your own business and invest on the side. However, remember an important thing. And that is that passive investments beat starting your own business for 90% of people, maybe 98% of people. Not for everybody. If you have been in business for 10–20 years, have built up a client base that would follow you, it can be easy to start your business, because you already have revenue and clients ready to follow you. It is only relatively easy as it was so tough in the past. However, nobody likes ideas that sound too `boring`, `tried and tested`. Far better to think you can reinvent the wheel, and start some sexy application or get rich quick. I will give you just one startling statistics. Many studies have estimated that 14% of teachers, yes teachers, in some countries are millionaires:  Now OK, that means 86% aren't. And yes most of the 14% `only` have $1M-$2M. Few are multi-millionaires. However, the reason why I am bringing this up is that few think a teacher can become a millionaire The truth is anybody can be a millionaire on a middle-class income. There are millionaires in all industries:  So, one of the `secrets` is that simplicity beats complexity. Getting a middle-class job, getting good at it, and then starting your own business, will probably beat trying to be the next Zuckerberg. Likewise, investing in index funds from 21 until you die, will probably beat some sexy stock market strategy. You don’t need to invest much to get rich if you start early enough:  All of the techniques take time unless you are lucky enough to inherit a bunch of money. And most of those people end up losing the money! Some reading The biggest financial headaches for people living in emerging marketsHow to become rich by investingWhere are the 120,000+ billionaires?Adam Fayed Podcast

Know that it is hard work, risky and boring but not impossible . Getting rich is simple, you must make more money than you spend then shun all the trinkets and ‘experiences’ you can buy in exchange for accumulating wealth. Most people can earn more, most people can start a business, most people then really struggle to build wealth because they prefer holidays, nicer cars, larger houses, better lifestyles. Unless you hit super-wealth with a business that you grow to enormous proportions, or inherit a sizeable estate, you are more likely to be in for a long, disciplined, slog to wealth. Say you start earning £20′000 a month. Not hard to do, but this is how it will pan out. As an approximation 25% needs to be retained for taxes. £15′000 per month left. Living costs of a family £5000 per month. £10′000 per month left to become rich with, after a year you could save £120′000 that will allow you to buy a £ 300′000 investment property fairly easily. That will then create an after tax and expenses income stream of approximately £500 - £700 per month. Hmmm, one year of saving to handle maybe 10% of your living costs. Year two accumulate another £120′000, you have choices, you can pay down your mortgage, always a good move, not exciting, but a solid choice. But again, slow progress. You can invest in stock markets and get a 10% yield or get burned in a crash or correction. For the average person, the route to wealth is a multi pronged attack, get your income up, then build assets and attack debt and cost-of-living-wealth-drains. None of this will happen overnight. Also expect change, a lot can happen in 10 years, it is also rather easy to become successful and rather hard to stay there as other people pile in to any good niche markets you may have found. It pays to be a free thinker, be prepared to invest in the new and unproven and take chances on new markets. Most of us will earn a lot in our lifetimes, not many of us are boring enough to hold on to decent chunks of it. I can be that dull, and I attract a lot of critics from the YOLO crowd. Who knows, I may be wrong! But the YOLO crowd seem to be short on actual answers to me. The other secret is that the people closest to you will either help you stay on track or slowly erode your discipline as they want to spend not accumulate. Be very careful about who you spend your time with. My other advice is that becoming obsessive about changing your life for the better with wealth building is a lot easier when you are young and can get on with it uninterrupted. Good luck! if you found my answer useful, please consider an upvote, thank you!

All clique stuff below- mostly intangible vs. some of the other ‘bam! glam’ headline links to roadmaps or webinars (that I admit probably have their merits). Risk / growth-mindset. The richest big guns have often experienced catastrophic failures and bankruptcies. You don’t have to go for that broke but you do have to not only be ok with loss but also see it as an opportunity to learn and an often necessary predecessor to better things. The areas with the biggest odds of generating wealth (for example, starting your own business [also with the biggest odds of failing], more lucrative investments) have a much higher risk and downside. Grit. Refer back to the above. When you lose your investment, your business turns belly up, funding for your idea dries up, you get rejected a few times or a few dozen or a few hundred (think Kentucky Fried Chicken founder, etc.), you have the grit to keep getting back up for another rodeo. This is hard. Vision. Often, written. Know your ‘why’ as well. Vision meted out into incremental goals. Treating learning as lifelong. Often, entails networking/surrounding yourself with people you can learn from (‘networking is the currency of today’s world’) and reading. And going back to the first point, finding ways to calculatedly throw yourself into the ring of fire, screw up, and get better. Self-efficacy. The belief in what you are doing, and the belief you can get where you want to be. That seemingly simple but Herculean ability to contain the doubting, self-denigrating part of you gives you superpowers. While you are working, don’t forget to find ways (especially early on) to make your money (excess capital, if you have it) work for you. Goes back to points most others already made here. Some degree of thrift especially early on. Honing your ability to communicate. (Learning to sell [yourself, your ideas, products] is one of the most powerful, intangible skills you could pick up. Selling will also teach you aforementioned grit and risk / growth mindset. Working is fundamental. But there are plenty who work hard all their lives and never get close (depending on how you define ‘rich’). You have to question if the work you are doing is getting you to where you want to be.
